Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2017 10:12AM - edited Feb 16, 2017 10:18AM by Brhenson91 thank you for the respond! I just saw my regular doctor today. He said that they did not see anything at all.. He said it could be that the lump moved when they pressed down with the ultra sound wand or it could be that the lump has the same density of surrounding tissue.. He wants me to follow up with a general surgeon and see if she can basically force them to do a mammogram or she may feel that it is nothing and have me watch it and come back after a few months.. It's super intimidating to me thinking about going to a general surgeon but I want answers! And to answer your question, yes it seems to change all the time with my menstrual cycle.. During my period it seems much larger..it has also gotten more tender

Posts.Content: Brhenson91 wrote: Hello, This is my first time posting and I am just looking for some advise.. I found a lump in my breast and I am very concerned. I went to my regular doctor and upon a breast exam he felt like I should have further testing. He referred me to a radiologist and I just had my appointment today.. I was scheduled for a mommogram and an ultra sound.. I had the ultra sound and the radiologist said that she didn't see anything and she was not going to do the mammogram because of my age.. I do not like the fact that she was ruling out doing a procedure due to my age.. I feel like I wasn't taken seriously and they said they did not see anything on my ultrasound.. How is this possible when me and my doctor felt this lump. I don't know if I should not worry and just trust the radiologist or if I should press the issue and get a second opinion. I have really large breasts so I'm worried that she just missed it!Any thoughts would be greatly appreciated! Thank you! Log in to post a reply
